4be1023469d96ff2.author: [REDACTED]
4be1023469d96ff2.comment: Have you read the inquiry or have you not?! What's all this rubbish about an inquiry treating someone fairly or not?Inquiries collect evidence under oath and on that evidence the way forward is charted. If the evidence points that an individual committed a crime than it goes in front of a court of law with a jury of peers under the guidance of a judge where it has to be decided 'without reasonable doubt' that the accused is guilty, or not. That is the place where utmost fairness is expected.An illegality is always illegality and if an illegality is committed by a public official it is automatically and aggravated offence. No one is above the law least of all those who were entrusted with the country's well being. Their good deeds, if any, do not cancel out any crimes they might have committed so stop this dangerous interference with the course of justice. You are neither judge nor jury, get out of the flippin way and leave justice to take its course. The courts are not on the ballot but your criminal political party is. Your party, has always been the party which eroded justice for its political gain, that is the fact.All the people have to ask is  'is there enough evidence, beyond reasonable doubt, that the accused have committed a crime against the country?! and that is done according to the constitution in a court of law.

d9f96ed45b1b83c7.author: [REDACTED]
d9f96ed45b1b83c7.comment: I don't believe Abela has an understanding of judicial process. The accused get to defend themselves in court AFTER charges have been laid. They're entitled to know the charges against them, but the forum to challenge them is open court, not horse trading with judges and the Attorney General.He's also clearly confused about the difference between a magisterial inquiry and a criminal investigation. The inquiry can give the opinion that certain people have a criminal case to answer; it cannot charge them, even if the evidence it uncovers is strong. And the evidence must be strong if an official as partisan as the Attorney General loses no time in pressing charges.My own opinion is that Abela is trying to run with the hare and hunt with the hounds, and cover himself whatever the outcome. The risk is that one of his stances will certainly be wrong.
